result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler John Myhre was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Pay fine of $200 plus costs.  
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to drugs and alcohol with the exception of controlled substances with a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.  
No contact with the Kizewski's unless they consent to contact in writing and agent recommends.

Participate in any other counseling as recommended by the agent. 
Write letter of apology to Annette Kizewski and her family. 
Parties participate in Victim Offender Conferenceing if available thru the probation agent and if the Kizewski family is willing to participate in that. 
Return any property to the Kizewski's that he has in his possession or that he has taken unlawfully. 
Court will allow probation to be transferred to Outagamie County. 
Provide a DNA sample.
Obtain AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Perform 80 hours community service, preferrably with the Portage County Parks Department or as agent deems appropriate.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Tyler John Myhre

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tyler John Myhre in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Louis Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:54 p.m.  Court calls the case. 
State files amended information. 

Atty Drengler received a copy of the amended information and waives its reading. 
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Atty Drengler makes statements re: his understanding of the agreement.  
Atty Molepske makes corrections. 
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes. 

Defendant enters a plea of:   Counts 1 thru 3 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 1 thru 3 of the amended information.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Convictions this date.

Victim makes statements to the Court. 
Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - 
60 days jail, STAYED
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months:
Pay $200 fine plus costs. 
80 hours community service, preferrably with the Portage County Parks Department or as agent deems appropriate.
Obtain AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to drugs and alcohol with the exception of controlled substances with a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Gain and maintain fulltime employment. 
Participate in any other counseling as recommended by the agent. 
Not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons. 
Write letter of apology to Annette Kizewski and her family.
No contact with the Kizewski's unless they consent to contact in writing and agent recommends. 
Parties participate in Victim Offender Conferencing if available thru the probation agent and if the Kizewski family is willing to participate in that. 
Return any property to the Kizewski's that he has in his possession or that he has taken unlawfully. 
Court denies the expungment request. 
Court will allow probation to be transferred to Outagamie County. 
Provide DNA sample. 

Atty Drengler believes he has 1 day of jail credit. 
BY THE COURT:  Court grants 1 day of jail credit. 

Count 2 -
30 days jail STAYED Consecutive to Count 1
Placed on probation for 2 years
With the same conditions 
Pay costs including the DNA Surcharge. 

Count 3 -
30 days STAYED Consecutive to Counts 1 & 2
Placed on probation for 2 years
With the same conditions
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.

ADDRESS INFO for Tyler John Myhre
Current: 5228 3rd Ave, Plainfield, WI 54966 United States  (Effective: 07-20-2015)
Prior: E1886 State Rd 54, Waupaca, WI 54981

State files Information which adds an additional charge. 
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Tyler John Myhre in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyler John Myhre in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Tyler John Myhre in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Renc is the defendant's counsel. 
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Atty Cousins asks for an adjourned initial. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Annette Kizewski or her place of residence or employment.
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
Submit DNA sample and send sample to crime lab.
Defendant to visit Public Defenders office today.

ADA Molepske appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of Burglary-Building or Dwelling.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $5,000  with conditions as stated.

Court questions Theresa Drallmeyer, mother of defendant, if defendant will be able to reside with her. 
Ms. Drallmeyer indicates she is willing to take him in.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  5-4-15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
